CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention;Procedure prescribed by law);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention);No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was arrested by gendarmes and taken into custody at the ORG gendarmerie command .

CARDINAL . On DATE the gendarmes took a statement from him . He was suspected of having assisted and supported the ORG ( ORG of Kurdistan ) , an illegal organisation under NORP law . He allegedly signed his statement while blindfolded . At the end of his detention in the gendarmes ' custody , he was examined by a forensic medical expert . No signs of ill - treatment were observed on his body .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after being interviewed by the public prosecutor , the applicant was brought before a judge of ORG , who ordered his detention pending trial . Before both the prosecutor and the judge the applicant denied the accusations against him . He was subsequently taken to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ruling on applications by the governor of the state of emergency region and the public prosecutor , and on the basis of LAW no . CARDINAL on additional measures to be taken in connection with the state of emergency , the judge granted leave for the applicant to be sent back to the gendarmerie command for questioning for a period not exceeding DATE . The applicant was returned to the gendarmes ' custody at TIME DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an objection by the applicant 's family , on the ground that the length of his detention was consistent with the limits laid down in domestic law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge extended the applicant 's detention at the gendarmerie command by DATE , again on the basis of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE an objection by the applicant 's representative was dismissed by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken back to prison .

CARDINAL . On DATE the governor of the state of emergency region and the public prosecutor , again on the basis of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL , asked the judge to extend the applicant 's detention at the gendarmerie command by a further DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge refused that request on the ground that the case file did not contain any evidence to substantiate it and that such an omission was attributable to the authorities .
CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor lodged an objection against that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the objection and observed that the applicant was the subject of CARDINAL other investigations . It granted a further DATE extension and leave for the applicant to be taken from prison for questioning .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was handed over to the gendarmes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge extended the applicant 's detention at the gendarmerie command by a further DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken back to ORG .
CARDINAL . Each time the applicant left and returned to the prison , he was examined by a doctor . The reports subsequently drawn up did not mention any signs of blows to the applicant 's body .
CARDINAL . In an indictment of DATE , the public prosecutor brought criminal proceedings against the applicant under LAW , by which it is an offence to be a member of an armed gang .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE , ORG ordered the applicant 's provisional release .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was acquitted in the absence of any evidence other than his initial statement to the gendarmes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's representative lodged a criminal complaint with the public prosecutor at ORG against the gendarmes , alleging that they had ill - treated the applicant in order to obtain a confession from him . He asked for the applicant to be given a thorough medical examination . He further submitted that the applicant 's recurring periods of detention at the gendarmerie command had breached both the provision of the LAW governing the maximum length of detention in police custody and LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG ruled that he did not have jurisdiction and forwarded the file to the ORG public prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was interviewed by the ORG public prosecutor . He asserted that he had been sprayed with cold water , had been insulted , threatened and beaten , had had his testicles squeezed and had been placed naked in front of a fan blowing cold air . He lodged a criminal complaint against the gendarmes involved in questioning him . He also requested a medical examination and treatment .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE to the ORG public prosecutor , the applicant 's representative reiterated his allegations of torture and asked for his client to be examined at a specialist medical department .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor ordered thorough medical examinations to be carried out at the urology department and a testicular scintigram and pelvic ultrasound scan to be carried out at the nuclear medicine department of ORG in order to detect any signs of ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . In a document of DATE , addressed to the ORG provincial governor , the public prosecutor sought leave to bring proceedings against the gendarmes in whose custody the applicant had been held .
CARDINAL . A urological ultrasound scan of DATE and a testicular scintigram of CARDINAL DATE did not reveal any abnormalities .
CARDINAL . A preliminary investigation was opened by ORG in respect of the gendarmerie commander .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG decided , in the absence of sufficient evidence , not to open an investigation with a view to prosecuting the official in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an objection against that decision with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision . The ORG public prosecutor 's office subsequently discontinued the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG against the decision to discontinue the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the appeal was dismissed in view of the decision by the ORG provincial governor 's office .
CARDINAL . As amended by PERSON no . DATE of DATE , LAW provides :
“ Everyone has the right to liberty and security of person .
No one shall be deprived of his liberty save in the following cases and in accordance with the formalities and conditions prescribed by law : ...
The arrested or detained person must be brought before a judge within TIME at the latest or , in the case of offences committed by CARDINAL person , within DATE ...
The close relatives of persons who have been arrested or detained shall be notified immediately of their circumstances . ...

Compensation must be paid by the ORG for damage sustained by persons who have been victims of treatment contrary to the above provisions , in accordance with the general rules governing the right to compensation . ”

CARDINAL . In addition , LAW provides that anyone who has been arrested or detained pending trial may confer in private with his or her legal representative , who does not need to have been given an authority to act .

CARDINAL . Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE on additional measures to be taken in connection with the state of emergency strengthened the powers of the governor of the state of emergency region . LAW ) provides that , on a proposal by the governor , at the request of the public prosecutor and by order of a judge , persons who are detained after being convicted or pending trial may be taken from prison for questioning for a period not exceeding QUANTITY days . They must undergo a medical examination on leaving and returning to prison .
CARDINAL . No court action may be brought against decisions of the governor of the state of emergency region .
Article CARDINAL of the legislative decree provides :

“ No criminal , financial or legal liability may be asserted against ... the governor of a state of emergency region or provincial governors in that region in respect of decisions taken , or acts performed , by them in the exercise of the powers conferred on them by this legislative decree , and no application shall be made to any judicial authority to that end . This shall be without prejudice to the rights of individuals to claim reparation from the ORG for damage which they have been caused without justification . ”

CARDINAL . ORG dismissed applications for review of LAW no . CARDINAL , finding that they were inadmissible ratione materiae on the ground that the legislative decree was not subject to constitutional review , in CARDINAL judgments delivered on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , published in ORG on DATE and DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . Since DATE the state of emergency in force in CARDINAL provinces of south - eastern GPE ( ORG and PERSON ) has been permanently lifted . As a result , Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL has ceased to apply since that date .
